alert.note: Alert for Sebastian (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 6:33AM CDT until June 10 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Crawford, Sebastian and Washington AR. In Oklahoma, Adair and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 945 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - 1 to 2 inches of rain have fallen with an additional inch or so expected before ending. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Fayetteville... Van Buren... Stilwell... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Farmington... Alma... Barling... Prairie Grove... West Fork... Lavaca... Lincoln... Mulberry... Westville... Greenland... Dyer... Winslow... Chester... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
